text: Bottle 50cl, a clear amber brown beer with good head. Nose is on caramel and toasted grain. Aroma on the same, toasted czramel, sweet body, grassy hops, herbal finish, toasted caramel on aftertaste.

Bottle, from a store in Prague. There is nothing particularly offensive about this beer, But on the other hand, this sweet, watery, coppery translucent lager is 100% forgettable. I still dont get this style.
0.5 l bottle from Hopaholic. I did not take notes while having this one, but not my cup of tea.
On draft at u kunstatu, Prague. Pours clear amber. Nose of berries, spices, forest fruit. Taste is fruity, spicy, nice.

On tap, @U Kuntátů, Praga. Viaje 03/2017
Color ambar, aromas a caramelo, malta, cuerpo ligero

Copenhagen 8/2 2017. 50 cl bottle from SuperBrugsen. Part of a "Ferdinand-giftbox". Brown label with all the mandatory heraldic stuff with shields, banners and a lot of gold. Why feel cheap when drinking beer? Pours clear red tinged amber with white head. Settles as 1 cm thick creamy layer of foam. Lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma is sweet and quite intense. Caramel, brown sugar with light sour notes. Soft carbonation and slightly thick palate. Flavor is quite sweet followed by medium bitterness. Pleasant Czech variation of a Vienna Lager.

Bottle. Reddish bronze coloured beer with a strong head. The aroma is lightly roasted and malty, and the flavour is gently malty with reasonable bitterness and roastedness. Overall a nice mixture of sweet and bitter beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tiszta vörös szín. Jó édes-keserű egyensúly. Mindenkinek bátran ajánlom, aki a cseh sörökkel ismerkedik.

Miedziane, klarowne ze świetną, wysoka pianą. W aromacie i smaku jest jakby nieco gorzej, ale nie jakoś źle. W aromacie trochę karmel, nieco ziół i trochę owoców. W smaku analogicznie. Dosyć słodko. Do tego lekko wodniście. Nagazowanie średnie. Goryczka występuje - aczkolwiek jest typowa dla lagera. Poprawne.
Keg at prague beer museum namesti miru. Pours clear amber, nose is malty toffee, grass, taste is sweet, malty, chewy caramel.
PL: Wygląd brązowo-ciemnawy. W zapachu dosyć wyraźnie zioła w połączeniu z karmelem. Smak dosyć podobny. Ekstremalnie pijalne, natomiast goryczka średnio-niska.
Beautiful clear caramel colour. Aroma is incredibly herbal, like a schnapps. Taste is fairly malty, a bit bitter, and finished with some spice.
Tap at Prague Beer Museum: Clear amber colored brew with an nicely sweet bitter taste, hints of caramel, plum and spices. Spices in an Czech small commercial beer, it is spot-on.
Bottle 500 ml. Pale amber with red color. Aroma: malt, caramel, dried fruits, raisins and candied jam. Taste: caramel, malt, hops, a little berry jam.

150ml taster, on tap at Prague Beer Museum. Solid lacework from a filmy layer. Crystal clear amber coloured body. Brown malty nose, roasted. Taste of roasted caramel malts with moments of almond and plums. Notes of leafy hops towards a mid-sweet ending. Medium bodied. Likable (01.07.2016).

Tap @ Csehsörnapok 2016. Először amikor még évekkel ezelőtt kóstoltam, aszittem belerohadt a csapba, de most voltam igazán kénytelen szembesülni vele, hogy ez tényleg savanyú. Vagy azóta sem tisztították a csapot.

Pours beautiful clear copper color with medium, slightly off-white head. Smell is a bit unusual, a bit herbal but mostly vegetable. 

Medium body with oily texture and vivid carbonation. Mostly bitter taste. Aroma of herbs, spices, vegetable malts and yeast. Bitter mouthfeel and dry finish. 

Overall, interesting. Takes time to get used to, but not bad. Not for everyone, tho.

(Kiev 2016) Sampled draft @ one of Pivnaya №1 establishments. Dark amber, cough syrup, creamy tanned head. Nose is skunk, rotting wet leaves, bad spoiled, low feces. Taste is sickening cough syrup, spoiled milk, leaves medicinal, sough syrup, feces. Creamy rotting leaves body. I suspect that the keg went bad, this isnt normal.

Bottle; 9th Polotmavy rating, with huge props to Nikos!! Pours clear orange amber, medium creamy beige head, dissipates leaving decent residual and lacing. Aroma is roast, caramel, toffee, grass. Flavor is light plus sweet, light bitter, lots of caramel, grassy hops, hints of smoke and roast. Medium body, low acidity. Good enough.

Bottle. Pours copper with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is cereal, caramel and slightly hoppy and fruity. Taste is caramel, cereal, cigarette smoke, unpleasantly bitter. Somewhat herbal bitter aftertaste.

Bottle - Clear ruby colour, nice off-white head with good retention and lacing. Intense malty and toffee aromas with some honey and nuts. Taste of caramel, bread, cereald, some stone fruits and gentle hop bitterness. Medium body and carbonation, silky texture. Great Czech lager.
On tap. Pours brown with medium white head. Aroma of malt, sour and bit of caramel. Medium body with light carbonation. Taste is sweet, dry and light sour.
Orangebrun klar med fingerhøyt beige skum. Lukter noe brent karamell, brunt sukker, noe humle mod røde bær. Balansert. Søtbitter noe brent smak. Kort.

Beczka (Praga). 
Aromat: chmielowo-ziołowy, słodowy z nutą paloną.
Wygląd: piana jest obfita, drobno pęcherzykowa. Piwo ma barwę ciemnego bursztynu i jest klarowne.
Smak: raczej słodkawe, palone i lekko karmelowe.
Odczucie w ustach: wysycenie na średnim poziomie, wyraźna gorycz chmielowa (może ziołowa), ale nie męczy a wręcz fajnie balansuje smak.
Ogólnie: smaczny, bursztynowy lagerek.

Lukt: Humle, malt og krydder.
Utseende: Grumset rust farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum.
Smak: FRuktr, humle malt.
Hvor: Kjø[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Beer Museum, Praha sammen med Bryne.

Amber color, large head. Aroma of caramel, hops, herbs. Taste caramel, bitterness, grain, balanced. Light sweet aftertaste combinated with very nice bitterness.
Amber, little head, very herbal aroma. Excellent freshness and quite light with a very pleasant bitter finish.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl.
Appearance - deep caramel with a nicely proportioned head. 
Nose - mainly caramel with a touch of malt and a hint of hazelnuts. 
Taste - caramel going into honey. Tangy orange. Very sweet. 
Palate - medium bodied with a big tangy texture and a long tangy finish which is just a bit too sweet. 
Overall - enjoyable but too sweet.
Has a nice mix of malt and vegetable flavours with an okay aroma of grain, but the mouthfeel is weak. Its a bad mix of efforts.

Tap at U Kuntastatu. Glowing, cler a,ber. Medium,mfinehed. Fruity, caramel mose, dry and bredy. Sweet flavor, caramel malts, earthy hops. Grass, herbs. Not too sweet, but a bit of brown sugar. Decent.

Draft @ Ølfestival 2015. Pours a pale amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty caramel aroma. Fruity malty grainy caramel bitter grassy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy caramel bitter finish.
sweet malty aroma,golden, clear, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, fizzy, sweet malty finish.
Fľaa z Nitrianskej pivotéky. Pekná, dobre driaca pena, príjemná chmeľovä aróma. Chuť plná, slad, chmel, v pozadí praený karamel. Chutné polotmavé pivko.

Clear ruby colored, medium strong offwhite head, creamy and lasting with nice lacing. Aroma is sweet, candy fruit and some noble hops. Taste moderately sweet caramel, some toast, candylike, dark fruits with medium noble hops bitterness and a rather lasting bitter aftertaste. Medium bodied.
Amber clear color, no foam, smells like lager. Aroma of light caramel, sugar and herbs. Light sweet taste. Not amused.
0.5l bottle. Clear amber color with small head. Aroma of plum and caramel. Taste is very sweet.
Dark amber colour with a nice off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, caramel and spice.

Pretty good beer, little too sweet for my palate, hop and herbal aroma very mild and in good balance with maltiness of beer. Caramel taste in aftertaste with little bitternes. Boring beer? No, not at all.
Clear amber brown body with a medium brown head. Aroma is malt, caramel. Taste is sweet and light bitter. Too sweet for me. Finish is flat sweet and light bitter.
amber / redish color, filtered. off white hdead. smells malty, grain, some malt sweetness. medium body, light malty, a bit like honey. finish is some sweetness first, but in the end finishes bitter.

0.5l bottle bought at Magic Beer Room. Dark amber/light brown body. Plum and caramel dominate the aroma. Very sweet on the palate (too sweet for me but I can see why people would like it), with a tiny bit of bitterness on the finish. Some hops if you dig deep enough. Was much better draught at the II. homebrew conference in Zagreb, but I could have been too exhausted and drunk to make a valid judgement.
500ml bottle from Premium Czech Beers online. Pours clear amber, thick off-white head. Aromas of light caramel, hazelnut maybe. Taste is light sweet, herbal bitter. Clean finish. Not bad.
Iható, a maga nemes egyszerűségével. Cseh sörben sem vagyok még kellően jártas, de ez a főzet felidézte a 10 évvel ezelőtti sörtúra zamatait. :-)

Jun 14. On tap at homebrewer competition in Magic beer room, Zagreb. It poured clear copper body with medium sized head. Caramel and bread aroma, predominately malty. Hops were evident only in the flavor, as lightly bitter balance for toasted malty dominance. Caramel, dark fruits and a bit of bread were most pronounced flavors. Medium bodied with sweetish and herbal bitter finish. Very good polotmavy!

3rd Oct 2014, on tap in Ferdinanda, Prague: by far their best beer on offer that evening, the other three being towards the bland and uninteresting types of beer challenges. This 7 Bullets brew came in lovely 0.4 litre vase shaped glasses with the beers name and logo on them. We had three each of these as we really took to the sweetness and flavours.

Pours a pleasant deep amber with a good sized white head that did try to stay but failed somewhat. Aroma was of malts, semi-sweet caramel, dark fruits and a toffee hint in the background. The taste would too sweet for some but my wife and I really took to it. So much more interesting flavour wise than the Pilsner/lager/dunkels we had tried before this brew. Light bitterness finished each sip off nicely and primed your taste buds for the next mouthful. One of the best beers we had in our beery week in Prague.

Pours a coppery color, clear, topped with about a finger of tan colored frothy head. Malty aroma, some fruity and caramel notes as well, slight soury smell too. The taste is quite bittery, slightly metallic and herbal. Nice and easily drinkable.

On tap, vegalite, 30czk/0.5l. Clear dark amber body wit high creamy head. Aroma is light caramel, licorice, dark fruits, plums. Taste has high earthy bitterness, medium caramel sweetness, herb like after taste. Body is full, high carbonation. Nice.

0.5L bottle. Pouts clear brown with a white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of bready and cereal malt as well as fruit notes. Sweet up front, tasting of dark fruit, raisin and plums, as well as sherry (deconcoction mash?). Middle is dry from hop bitterness, and this falls off quickly leaving a sweet film in the back of the throat. Medium-full body with a slick texture and average carbonation. Overall, a relatively sweet beer that offers some interesting malt complexity.

On tap, Beer Club Pula. Slightly hazy deep amber color, average sized off white head. Medium body, lively carbonation. Strong caramel aroma, malt, dried fruits. Medium sweet, light bitter taste. Again caramel in somewhat dry finish.

Clear dark amber color with medium sized off-white fast disappearing head. Taste is bittersweet and pleasant. Caramel nose. Thin body, average carbonation. Some hops hidden in aroma. Bitter finish. Awesome beer for such a low price. (Vrutak 0,5l bottle)
Bottle, pours amber with a beige head, light sweet taste of malt and caramel with a slight bitter finish, not bad.
Draught. Amber color with white head. Aroma is malt, caramel and toffee. Taste is sweet with some hop bitterness as well. Overall its quite balanced and easy drinkable beer.

Draught
Aroma-herbs, floral, 
Appearance-amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-very good

Pours really nice deep amber colour with minimal sized white head. Aroma is malts, some caramel, roast, raisns, dark fruits, maybe toffee. Light to medium body. Some hoppiness in there also. Sweetish taste followed by some bitternes. Not bad. Pleasant surprise.

On tap, Prague beer museum. Pours red-brown with a smooth off-white head. Aroma mostly yeast, taste bitter-sweet, dried fruits, plum jam. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ hotel room in Prague. Pours a clear bronze brown body with a medium creamy off-white head. Great looks on this one. Aroma is caramel, raisins, mild nuts and hints of grains. Taste is caramel, bread, nuts, grains and hints of bitter herbs and straw. Light to medium body, medium carbonation. A very solid and super-drinkable Czech dunkel.

Draught @ Prague Beer Museum at Náměstí Míru, Prague. Pours dark amber with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, little spice, caramel, grass, light fruit. Flavor is malt, wood, little dark fruit, grass, little spice. Medium body, lively carbonation. 200414
Tap. Clear, amber color, medium-sized short-life off-white head, toffee aroma, from light to medium body, too fizzy for me, sweet malty and caramel taste, decent simple hoppy bitter palate.

A very good discovery!! :)
Good taste from Praha!! :)
..........................................
On tap at Ferdinanda, Prague. Pours dark amber with white head. Roasted malty with some caramel. Medium bodied, some metallic taste as well.
Czech beer that actually has some flavor. Its a bit bitter, malty and a bit hoppy. The yeast is present as well. Decent.

Rotbraunes, klares Dunkles mit verhältnismäßig wenig weißen Schaum. Karamellmalzaroma mit duftigem, floralen Hopfen. Frischer Antrunk, etwas dünn. Wunderbare Balance zwischen malzaromatischem Beginn und zartbitteren Abgang, dazwischen irgendwo auch feine Fruchtnoten. Ein Zechbier.
Amber color, medium head. Aroma of herbs and malt. Very strong herbs aroma. Bitter aftertaste
50 cl. flaske købt i Magasin i Aarhus. 5,5%. Sød lækker rødbrun øl med brunt skum. Tjekkisk øl når det er bedst
Bottled , Prague , CZ , Malt,caramel,fruity and herbal aroma , Clear amber color with smaller lasting head , Sweet taste with longer light bitter finish , Medium body , Soft carbon , Pleasant beer.
50cl bottle thanks to Jamedra. Dark orange to copper color with thin to medium head. Carbonation is soft. Taste is medium bitter. Aroma is malty, caramel, herby and hoppy.
From bottle in Prague; pours a nice ruby red ... taste almost of a carbonated root beer .. quite nice and different .. I would consider buying again

clear ambercolour, medium yellowish head;aroma of caramel, bread, floral hops and intensive apple; tasteis mainly dominated by maly sweetness with caramel, however moderate hoppy bitterness can also be felt; really not bad
On tap. Pours brown color, white head. Aroma is caramel, roasted malt. Tastes medium sweet, burned caramel, roasted malt, coffee.

Bottle. Amber brown colour, big golden creamy head. Aroma is sweet, brown sugar, malty, bit of spicy apple. Taste is good, nice sweetness, caramel, brown sugar, light fruitiness. Actually really nice and easy to drink.

(bottle) pours a clear deep amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of heavy cooked vegetables, some light caramel and grass. flavour is mostly the same, heavy kidney beans, herbal hops, light roasted malts and some peanuts in the light-bitter finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Пиво янтарно& кольору , невисок& але стійка піна. Гарний зразок віденсь& лагеру

- via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Keg at Ferdinand. Pours Reddy Brown with a white head. Aroma of caramel and grassy hops. Flavour of caramel Apples. Somewhat thin.
Mörk gyllene färg med vitt skum, Doftar söt unken malt, brödig ton med en klassisk tjeckisk karaktär.
Dość dobre piwo treściwe i mocno słodowe. Mało goryczki, bąbelki i gaz trochę utrudniają degustację, ale warto pokosztować to wiedeńskie w stylu piwo pochodzące z Czech

Kobber klar skum hvid tæt 
Bær nødder træ humle malt 
Bitter modrat sæd modrat 
Vande 
@karlsbro
Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light caramel and bready. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 290512
Bottle, Clear brown/dark golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, bread and a little caramel. Flavour is malt, bread, medium sweet, caramel, hop and a little bitter.

(Bottle 0,5l)
Very light sweet, almost not detectable aroma. Clear amber color. Medium white head. Medium sweet, light caramel taste, no bitterness. Medium body, sticky texture. Astringent finish.
Bottle. Pretty good beer,nice color and smell, decent hoppy taste and palate.
Tap. Medium airy short lasting head. Clear amber colour. Aroma mostly of caramel, notes of hops.  Taste medium sweet, touch of citric sourness. The finish turns into medium bitter.
15 cl testöl på Prague Beer Museum. Svaga dofter av gräs och karamell, samma går igen i smaken tillsammans med nslag av lakrits. Trist öl.

draft.  clear striking rusty orange body with a fluffy and lasting white head. sweet approach turning somewhat thin and flabby with low acid, low bitterness, medium chewiness and noticeable yeast esters (berry, apple, orange).  straightforward munich malt toffee and caramel, a bit too chewy and thin and out of balance, finishing with orange esters and caramel. nothing special.
Fue la que mas gusto de las Ferdinand, hermoso color rojo ambar,olor a maltas dulces y al paladar agradable,media frutada y suave. Recomendada
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: Draft at Ferdinanda. Red-brown clear body and a off-white lasting head. Aroma of nuts, caramel, brown sugar and some fresh citrus. Medium sweet and light bitter - well balanced. Oily texture and some sticky as well.

Draught at Ferdinand Monarchia in Budapest, Hungary.
Dark reddish brown colour with small white head.
Yeasty, dry woody, nutty and malty aroma.
Dry mild hoppy bitterness in flavour. Not my favourite but still quite drinkable. Soft carbonation.

Bottle. Reddish brown with a frothy but not durable head. Aroma is grainy malt, some light caramel, a faint fruitiness and herbal-hoppy elements. Quite high carbonation, moderately full body and slightly sourish, crisp taste with a moderate, durable herbal-hoppy bitterness. Good one!
So called "half-dark" beer. It is decent, nothing amazing. Slightly sweet with a nice aroma.

IV. Cseh sörnapok, Budapest. Pirosas, világosabb vörösbarna színe van, habja kissé sárgás és krémes. Illata nagyon gyümölcsös, tejkaramellás és komlós. A csak nagyon simogatóan karamellás, malátás és gyümölcsös édeskés ízekre rárepül a füves, és nagyon gyümölcsös érzetű komló, és váratlan keserűséggel fut végig! Közepesen testes, jó száraz és keserű, üdítő szénsavassággal bíró remek félbarna! Az egyik legjobb szerintem az egész fesztiválon, kicsit hasonlít a Hamurappi álmára, mindkettőt feltétlen érdemes kipróbálni.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2011 Botlle from Zly casy, Prague. Copper color with small white head. Roasted malt, caramel, spices in aroma. Taste, red fruit, caramel, toffee, raisins, hints of coffee. Nice long bitter finish. Drinkable beer.
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2014 Pours clear amber with off-white head. Aroma of hops, caramel, yeast and light grainy notes. Taste add some light citrus and a malt profile in the background.
Aroma/Malty-light, Appearance Head/Initial-small, Head/Color white, Body/Hue-medium, Initial Flavor-bitter light Finish Flavor-bitter light Palate/Body-light Palate/texture-watery,  good beer
Nice amber pour with a dense white head. Aroma is yeasty, caramel, grassy hops, slightly fruity. Tastes malty, grassy, hoppy, yeasty.

Aroma not so interesting. Taste has nice complex malt, well balanced. Hop  hint. Somewhat watery in the palate.

 A real thirst quencher, with complexity and volume. 

 Purchased in bottle at Ølkonsortiet, Ålborg.

Tap @ Ferdinanda, Prague. Clear orange with two fingers thick creamy tanned head. Excellent lacing. Butterscotch, caramel, toffee in the aroma. Sweet and bitter flavors in a good balance with some alcohol. Medium body. Syrupy texture. Nice palate.
Bottle from Quack-Duck, thanks! Brown color. Malty, raisinny aroma with grapes and a hint of metal. malty sweet flavor with raisin and caramel. Hints of roast and chocolate.

Csapolva a "3. Cseh Sörfesztivál"-on.
Szép borostyán szín, habja világosbarna, krémes, mely végig vékonyan megmarad.
Illata karamellás, gyümölcsös.
Íze az előzőeknek megfelelő, nagyon kellemes.
Aromája elsősorban karamell malátás, enyhe füves komlóval kiegészítve.
A befejezés fűszeres és száraz.
Könnyen iható, jó kis ser volt ez.

Tasted ?? (forgotten back-log). Pours clear, dark, red with beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty and a little nutty. Flavours of caramel, dark candis. A bit like an irish coffee. Actually fairly good. I was surprised - thought it would be yet another drink and forget.

0.5 L bottle from Pivovarsky Klub, Praha.  Two fingers of dense, yellow shaded, blond head. Body is sparkling, bright ruby brown.  Moderate aroma of dryish, lightly toasted malts.  Some dusty and metallic hops.  Taste is medium sweet, light malty, with a slight astringent accent, apperantly from the herbs added. A faint sourness and some noticable bittering hops underneath. Light to medium body strenght. Lively mouthfeel. Dryish, herbal, mild hop bitter ending.

clear amber, large smooth offwhite head.
nice malty slight bready note, dry, caramel.
flavor is bitter caramel, some malty sweetness. makes me think of the malty flavor from barley wine but of course much weaker.
palate is a bit too fizzy.
a very tasty beer.
Bottle. Dark amber colour with a nice off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, caramel and spice.

Bottle. Clear amber body with a creamy longlasting off-white head. Very malty aroma with some dried fruit and caramel. Malty flavour with some herbal notes as well as lots of caramel and fruit. Medium bodied.

Bottled 50cl. Courtesy of Quack-Duck. It pours a clear amber beer. Malty nose with hints of raisins. Quite a lot of vinegar presence in the taste- very unusual. Strange. Cloying after a few sips. Notes of raisins showing up again. Unpleasant acidic metallic finish. Not my kind of beer. Thanks Quack-Duck!

Deep amber-reddish colored body with a nice off white-tan head. Aroma of toasted malt and caramel, some floral notes of hop. Smooth mouthfeel with a nice vienna character like tosted caramel, toffee, some sweet grains. Fine moderated and balanced hop, some fruity tastes in the finish. Correct one, i could sip it for hours with buddies...

Clear amber color with medium sized beige head. Light toffee aroma. Toasted malty flavor with herbal spiciness and some liquorice. Good dry, peppery long hoppy finish with slight alcohol notes.
Thick oily texture with medium balanced body and lively carbonation. One more please!
Vöröses barna színű,kemény,tömör habbal rendelkező ital.Illata karamellás,virágos.Íze pörkölt malátás,gyümölcsös,komlós,kesernyés.Utóíze kellemesen száraz,hosszan tartó.Nagyon jó!
caramel, floral, hazy, amber, brown foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, thick feel, long finish,
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text:
On tap at Ferdinanda, Prague 12.11.2008.
Comes dark amber with a medium sized off- white head. Malty, spicy aroma.
Sweet taste, caramel. Spiced and smoked as well, nice long spicy end.

Biggish creamy beige-brown shiny lasting head. Lovely brown body with carbonation. Malty spicy roasty aroma with roasted almond notes. Sweetish spicy roasty licorice taste with grassy hop notes. Good harmony and balance. Mid-bodied. Dry watery roasty dusty earthy aftertaste. Spicy roasty taste lingers for a long time. Nice, and highly drinkable. (0.4l bottle, U Ferdinanda, Prague.)
Bottle. Dark amber colour with large creamy off-white mostly lasting head. Malty aroma with notes of caramel. Very sweet flavor with light bitter notes. Oily palate.
Seven Bullets, on tap, pours amber, medium frothy white head.  Lgiht bread and malt aroma.  Toasted malt, nutty body, heavily spiced finish(peppery) joined by some alcohol.

Bottled(500ml). -Amber ruby coloured, medium sized beige head, slight herbal nose. Light roasted malt, caramel and grainy taste with grainy and light alcoholic notes. Also a bit metallic, mild spicy herbal finish.

0.5l bottle courtesy of and shared with ogivlado (thanks!) Poured a dark brown-red colour with a medium sized beige head that went away slowly. Grainy nose, notes of caramel and raisins.  The taste isn’t far off, being grainy, caramelly and sweetish... dark malts. Not all that hoppy...almost at all. Says it’s brewed with some herbs but there’s nothing that would reveal their presence except (in my mind) maybe for a vague, just kinda herbal chalkiness. It’s still a good dunkel or vienna, not too sweet.

(Draught at Ferdinanda, Prague, 23 July 2008) Dark ruby colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, toasty nose with spicy hints of wild berries. Malty, spicy taste with notes of wild berries, caramel and spicy hops in the finish. Medium body, rather sweet. Interesting and drinkable.
Clear brown with medium off white head. Sweet fruity and grainy aroma with caramel and roasted malt notes. Very sweet flavor with roasted malt and caramel notes. Ends sweet.

50 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden amber with a lacing white head. Light spiced malty aroma. Flavour is mildly roasted malt with a light acidic note. Ends with a lingering caramel malt flavour and light spice note.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is amber brown. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits and malt.
Bottle. Brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, fruit, malt. Flavour is caramel, fruit, sweet, hop, roasted. OK beer, but nothing more.

Bottle. A nice, clear, brown beer with a slightly small, beige head. Caramel, some roasted notes, dried fruits and a vague note of cooked vegetables. Nice, slightly roasted flavor. Pleasant flavor of fresh fruits as well. The bitterness is quite subdued, and is mostly there in the finish. Medum fullness with a pleasant level of carbonation. A truly quaffable beer, combining roasted malt and fruityness in a nice way. (071215)

Dark amber with a moderate head. The aroma is very malty and the flavour is sweetish and malty with light notes of caramel and licorice. The finish is dry and rather bitter. Initially it was so sweet that I almost poured it down the drain, but after a few mouthful it became better, and it actually have something to offer.

Bottle, bought @ Kolding Vinhandel. Pours a pretty, clear red amber with a smallish fluffy off white head. Aroma has lots of caramel, lightly roasted and a apple scent in the back. Nice, regular Vienna mouthfeel, not too watery nor too full. Malty caramel flavours dominate with a toffee twist as well as a dry roasted hoppy finish.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2011 First ratingDraught at Ferdinanda, PrahaClear dark brown color, fluffy tan head. Sweet roasted malty scent. Smooth sweet malty caramel taste. Smooth mouthfeel, low bitterness. Malty dry aftertaste.6/4/6/4/13=3.3RerateDraught at Prague Beer Museum on June 5, 2011Hazy copper color, fluffy off-white head. Spicy and acidic scent, a bit sour. Malty but sour rasre, I dont think this is OK. Thin mouthfeel, low bitterness.Wont let this rating push down the previous, since this beer must have gone bad at this place, or else served out of an old keg or similar.4/4/4/2/7=2.1
medium sized head, the beer is quite dark in colour. Malty aroma. Malty taste, the herbs are in the background, but traceable.
Draught at Københavnske Øldage 2007. Clear amber - no head. Caramel, ryebread, light smokey notes, sweetness, light nice hoppy, dry. Low carbonation. Smooth.

Tap at Chr. firtal, Odense. Red amber with fine white head. Aroma has roasted malts- Little metal malty caramel taste with a dry hoppiness. Silky smooth texture that is closer to watery than to thick. Overall good and drinkable Czech brew!

Bottled. Dark reddish amber colour with a longlasting beigeish head. Aroma of caramel malts and some slight hops and berries. Flavour is spices, slightly roasted malts and a hoppy bittery finish. Not really much aftertaste.
Bottle. Darkish amber colour with a mostlylasting light brownish head. Sweet aroma of dark malts with caramel. Flavour is sweet, toasted malts, caramel with bitter hops. A bit thin but good beer.
Bottle. Dark brown with a small, thick head. Fresh berry aroma. Taste of herbs, hops and a very warming finish.
Dark amber with a medium head. Nie and clean malt aroma. Malt and hay flavour without much going on.

On tap at The Pivovarsky Klub, Prague, unfiltered, 300ml. Cloudy dark amber with malty head. Over the days we came in here we found that this bar particularly enjoys to serve unfiltered Czech beer, and more power to them, I hope it is succesful. There was a lot going on in this beer it was bitter and woody initially, rather as if it had been stored in an oak barrel then came through a sweetish, sherry like body with an alcohol burn and finally a nutty finish, I agree not a lager as such, but a Vienna? maybe. I see it was brewed in honour to Ferdinand dEste, well there could be a lot worse things to remember him by. A good beer made better by serving unfiltered.

Bottle: Amber coloured, mid-sized fluffy head, slowly diminishing; sweet-malty, caramelly nose with a tinge of herbal hops; sweetish flavour, medium ti full bodied; first sweet-malty finish, later a slightly bitter aftertaste. Well drinkable !
Why is this beer called "Seven bullets" (Sedm kuli) ? The austrian heir to the throne Ferdinand dEste, who lived to the year 1914 near Benesov, was killed in Sarajevo by seven bullets. This was the beginning of WW I !
Deep amber colour with fairly big off white head. Malty aroma with caramel sweetness.  Flaovr is sweet as well, toffe, some bitterness.

(Bottled) Clear, reddish amber color with almost no head. Somewhat stuffy, herby aroma with dark fruit hints. Sweet, caramely-malty, slightly roasty flavor with cherries and ashiness. Light to medium-bodied, a bit thin, quite low-carbonated palate. A bit strange brew, but not very interesting.

Bottle. Red brown color with large light brown head. Light aroma of roasted malt and hops
Flavor is sweet roasted malt, caramel and sweets combined with hops and the dry taste of nutts.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2006 Amber of color, nice cloudy head. sweet aroma of caramel and sweets, hints of old apples. Stille the sense of old apples in the taste combined with hops and the dry taste of nutts.

Draught @ Hotel Antygl, Sumava. Mid brown. Noce light coffee and toasty malts. Light sweetness and slight herby bitterness to balance. Major prob was excess fizziness ruining the soft flavours, without that it could have been very good.

Big head though beer smell, lace, and nice reddish dark colour. Well malted. Carbonation on the aggressive side. Overall bold taste, with some herbal addition. There is a bit of yeast and wheat in the taste. Good finish.A good Vienna, thanks to Jan Biegeman

Advertised in the Ferdinand bar as Seven bullet stout, so I was suprised to see a copper coloured beer, with a small off white head being poured for me. Anyway, not a worry. Aroma is very floral, with some caramel. The body is very full and has great balance, with some spices, grapefruit and crystal malt. The finish is a little sweet, but enjoyable.
Moderate malty aroma. Huge frothy off-white head. Excellent lasing Mostly lasting. Clear body. Brown body hue. Moderate bitter initial flavor. Average duration. Medium to full  oily palate.

Bottle. Frothy off-white good mostly lasting head. Dark amber almost brown colour. Heavy caramellic malty aroma.
Nice flavor, slightly bitter. oily palate.

Tap. Superb colour, deep ruby amber with large creamy fine head. Good grainy, malty, nice gentle roast. Very malty, fruity character, full bodied. Malt work. Rich and drinkable. Smooth, great finish. Light roast feel. Perfect as session beer.
Bottle. Off-white head. Clear dark red brown body. Fruity malt aroma. Dry hops flavor with herbs tickling your tongue. Nice surprise.

One of the highlights of my Czech beer experience, and the beer that changed my mind about the Vienna style. This beer is very dark red.  It has a thick head that lacesthe glass and never completely fades.  Aroma has caramel, malt, fruit, and hops.  Malt flavor with tannic red wine; dry like wine with a similar mouthfeel. Excellent palate.  Very good.
Pours a clear bronze with a tanned head. Sweet and malty with slight aromas of fruits. Quite dry with a dry finish. Medium to full bodied.
Amber colour, and a real fine big head. Not much aroma. Flavor is a bit funny, some czechish-notes, mixed with some acidity.

(Bottle 50 cl) A "Kräuterbier" - that is a beer presumably with added herbs. Clear, pretty, dark brown with a small, beige head. Lots of caramel and malt in the flavour. And the exact same characteristics are found in the flavour. No traces of the herbs though - and they dont appear on the list of ingredients either. 280705

[At Københavnske Øldage 2005] A hazy red beer with a disappearing orange head. The aroma is sweet malty with some notes of metal, while the flavor is sweet malty with notes of caramel, and a dry metallic end.
Bottle. Clear brown colour. Malty flavour. Roasted, apple aftertaste.

(on bottle) Named after the seven bullits that killed the price of austria7hungari and started the first world war; the end of human trust in machines? Morbid, but the beer is different peacefull and ordinary. has a sweet, butterscotch, malty taste, bit creamt too. Smooth beer, with a faily good hopping for the balance in the finish.

Bottled at DBF 2005.
Brown coloured with a small beige head.
Unpleasant malty aroma with notes of caramel.
Not much carbonation.
Malty flavour with notes of caramel. Slightly hoppy finish.
Bottle. Dark amber colour with a off-white head. Light sweet Malty caramel aroma and a sweet thin taste. Light body and a sweet finish.
Bottle at DBF2005. Sweet and malty nose. Dark amber colored body, small off-white head. Mlaty flavor, cookie, some bitter finish.
Deep amber colour with fairly big off white head. Malty aroma with caramel sweetness. Flavor has a lot of caramel sweetness and a hoppy bitter finish.
aroma is tart and malty. red color with cute lil white head.  flavor is slightly smokey malty and unpleasantly bitter at end.  caramel strong
vinegary alchoholic aroma. soft yet fizzy head and a coca cola colour. tangy tingly palate.

Draught: Sweet and smooth. Big head. Nutty and toffee-like aroma. Hops in the end. Very good.
Bottled: Almost as good!

Excellent brew; deep red in colour and a toffee nose.  Sweetish but balanced flavour of toffee malt, some roastiness and grains.  Very tasty and full bodied; really drinkable!  (Bottle from Pivni Galerie, Holeovice)

Brilliant ruby-chestnut; slim white rim. Nose with bread, sweet like Marssala or other dark dessert wine, definitely vinous. Taste again bready and very faintly vinous. Finish is bitterish, rather metallic. Maybe rather Balsamico than wine. Medium body, bit watery at the end. Not bad. I wonder whence the name ("seven bullets", thanks motelpogo). It's certainly not seded with diacetyl, what I fear most from imported Czech stuff.

Bottled. Deep bronze red, poor head and condition. Malt wortlike aromas with some woody vinegar notes towards the end. Vaguely dunkle like but a fruity vinegar note still noticable in the mouth. Worty sweet finish does it few favours
I dont know what the people rating this are thinking. Beautiful ambarishCzech lager. Its not 13% alcohol, its 13% gravity or something. Smooth, flavorful, and czech flavored!!!!!!!

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2007 Draught. Sampled at Stockholm Beer Festival 2003.
Dark amber.
Aroma from buttertoffe and minced meet(?).
Rather sweet with flavour from toffee. Some bitterness.

(Stockholm Beer Festival 2003)
Amber with a creamy head. Aroma is toffee, sweet and nice. Flaovr is sweet as well, toffe, some bitterness.

Pours a light orange brown, clowdy islands of head float atop. . . deep sticky hazelnut malt aroma, that has a sweet component like cherry oak. . . acidic palate that has metallic notes and good spice, but overall a bit thin.  Malty flavour is present in the finish with some thin airy caramel and syrup.  Lingering hoppiness leaves a nice taste and saves this one for me.

Bottled.Deep amber colour with red hue, big burnt sugar flavour. Ive had this style before and liked it. It takes a little bit of time to get into but then you  begin to enjoy it after a while. Long palate and flavour, the develops in the mouth. Didnt taste anything like 13%....b/c that was the degrees plato. Thanx Rauchbier.
Very inviting amber/redish  color with a rocky head. Not much aroma. Can't put my finger on the taste - is it grassy? Somewhat sweet with tones of caramel.
some red wine in the aroma. brown sugar and some cocoa powder. pretty unremarkable

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2004 Sampled draugh at Stockholm Beer Festival.
Red-amber. Raisiny, slightly grassy aroma. Sweetish start, some crystal malt character. Dryer finish with low bitterness.
